content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
Consists of the factory interface components used for copper‐cable production:
– Cable factory input chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
– Burner inserter placed at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5) (its neighbors include another burner inserter at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5))
– Assembling machine at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5) that processes copper into copper cables

### Extraction Depot at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
This depot is intended to serve as an isolated belt depot for routing extracted items:
– Depot wooden chest placed at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5) serving as the belt target
– Transport belt segment adjacent to the chest at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5)
– Depot burner inserter installed at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5) with a pickup at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5) and drop at Position(x=3.5, y=13.5)

### Extraction System Interface at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5)
This interface provides the extraction input to the belt network:
– Extraction system burner inserter at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5) with drop position at Position(x=-3.5, y=28.5)

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Transport Belt Connection Errors  
 – When attempting belt connections, the target was erroneously interpreted as a steam engine. Always ensure the belt is connected to an appropriate inserter (or similar intermediary) rather than directly to a Prototype.SteamEngine object.

• Placement Distance Issues  
 – Wooden chests could not be placed when the target position was too far (distance exceeding the allowed maximum). Move closer to the target position before attempting placement.

• Inventory Shortages  
 – Attempts to place a wooden chest sometimes failed due to the chest not being available in the inventory. Confirm the inventory has the required item prior to placement.

• Undefined Variable Errors  
 – A NameError occurred because the variable ‘target_chest’ was not defined. Verify that all variable names are correctly declared and consistently referenced.
